result.execSummary:
The defendant Daishun Stephon Dixson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit of 99 days time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample; pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Payable in 2 years or civil judgment. Court waives all non mandatory court costs due to inability to pay. 
- Restitution set at ZERO.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with: RAE, TRL, RTL, EAS.

- Report to probation today.
- Mental Health Assessment and compliance with any treatment.
- Successfully complete a behavioral and cognitive thinking program.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Random drug and breath tests.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 1; STRAIGHT TIME; with credit of 99 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daishun Stephon Dixson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daishun Stephon Dixson in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Daishun Stephon Dixson.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2: 
PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit of  99 days, TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years. This is to run CONSECUTIVE TO CASES 21CM2821, 21CM3196, and 22CM570.

AS TO COUNT 2:    
Defendant ordered to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, with credit of 99 days time served, CONCURRENT to count 1. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years. This is to run CONSECUTIVE TO CASES 21CM2821, 21CM3196, and 22CM570.

WITH THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS: 
- Report to probation today.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Payable in 2 years or civil judgment. 
- Court waives all non mandatory court costs due to inability to pay. 
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.
- Maintain Absolute sobriety.
- Random drug and breath tests.
- Mental health assessment and compliance with any treatment. 
- Successfully complete a behavioral and cognitive thinking program. 
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain full time work. 
- Restitution set at ZERO.
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- 10 HOURS of community service. 
- No contact with: RAE, TRL, RTL, EAS
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

AS TO COUNTS 3 and 4  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea

Defendant Daishun Stephon Dixson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery  and  request a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned.    Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Daishun Stephon Dixson not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Bail/bond hearing proceeded.  Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court DENIED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record.
Defense request a pre-trial conference. Court ordered matter adjourned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Robert E., Taylor L., Ryan L., Emily S., Northern border McKinley Ave./ Knapp St., Southern Border St. Paul Ave., Eastern Border Van Buren St. in the City and County of Milwaukee, WI.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
No possession of any burglarious tools.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Daishun Stephon Dixson in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Daishun Stephon Dixson in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
